intro: Pilosella kajanensis, commonly known as the Kajan's goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense cluster, giving it a fluffy appearance. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Pilosella kajanensis is often found in alpine meadows and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
